SUMMARY: NESTED | FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD DETAIL: FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD

com.wizarpos.devices.smartcardslot
Interface SCSControl

All Superinterfaces:
DeviceControl, TimeConstants
public interface SCSControl
extends DeviceControl, TimeConstants

SCSControl定义了IC卡的使用接口。

这个Control需要通过DeviceManager获得，Control的open()方法被调用后，会和对应的设备服务 连接。Control的close()被调用后，这个连接会断开。

device is an exclusive device. It can't be opened again if it's already opened.

Version:
July 01, 2013
Author:
Haiqing Jin

Method Detail

open

void open(int scsID)
          throws DeviceException
连接到某个IC卡读卡槽。

一旦连接到读卡槽，Control需要立即检测当前IC卡是否已经插入卡槽， 如果已经有IC卡在卡槽中，则需要获得当前上电状态。这个状态信息可以 通过 getPowerState()获得。

Parameters:
scsID - 打开IC卡读卡器的设备编号，0对应底部的插槽，1、2、3对应终端背面的PSAM卡槽
Throws:
DeviceException - 参考DeviceException中的定义
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - 参数错误
See Also:
getPowerState()

getProtocol

int getProtocol()
                throws DeviceException
获得表达当前卡槽和卡片通讯协议的常量，常量定义在SCSControl中。

这个值只有在powerOn()方法被调用后才有效。

本方法是个同步方法。当卡槽中有卡片存在，并且成功powerOn或者reset后，协议可以获得， 并且被存放在Control对象中，可以被随时读取。

Returns:
卡片通讯协议的常量：
ASYNCH_T0
ASYNCH_T1
SYNCH_1
SYNCH_2
UNKNOWN
Throws:
DeviceException - 参考DeviceException 中的定义，同时还包括:
  • BAD_CONTROL_MODE - 如果卡片没有open
See Also:
powerOn()

setProtocol

void setProtocol(int protocol)
                 throws DeviceException
Sets the protocol to use with the card in this reader slot.

This method is synchronous. The information is locally stored in the control object; the value is updated by this method.

For synchronous cards, the application must select the right protocol with setProtocol() before calling powerOn(). Otherwise powerOn() will result in an ERR_PROTOCOL error.

For asynchronous cards, powerOn() and reset() normally automatically negotiate the protocol (as the protocol is usually defined by the ATR). In the case where the application wants to change the protocol, setProtocol() will take effect on the next sendData() method call. If the new protocol is incorrect, sendData() will result in an ERR_PROTOCOL error.

Parameters:
protocol - a constant indicating the card protocol to be set:
ASYNCH_T0
ASYNCH_T1
SYNCH_1
SYNCH_2
UNKNOWN
Throws:
DeviceException - for the standard reasons that are documented in DeviceException and also:
  • with code BAD_CONTROL_MODE - if the control is not open
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if protocol is not a valid constant

getPowerState

int getPowerState()
                  throws DeviceException
Retrieves the card slot power state, as defined in SCSControl.

A state transition diagram for the smart card states returned by this method may be found in the package summary.

This method is synchronous. The information is locally stored in the control object; the value is updated when one of the methods affecting the card slot power state (open, powerOn(), powerOff(),reset()) is successfully completed. Note that the power state value can also be updated when the smart card slot service's related status listener is invoked on the methods cardInserted or cardRemoved.

Returns:
a constant indicating card slot power state:
OFF
ON
CARD_ABSENT
Throws:
DeviceException - for the standard reasons that are documented in DeviceException and also:
  • with code BAD_CONTROL_MODE - if the control is not open
See Also:
powerOn(), powerOff(), reset()

setMode

boolean setMode(int mode)
                throws DeviceException
Sets the smart card reader slot operating mode.

This method informs the device that the application expects to operate in a particular mode. setMode() is called before powerOn().

This method is synchronous. The information is locally stored in the control object; the value is updated by this method.

Parameters:
mode - the card-handling mode to be used; ISO or EMV as defined in SCSControl.
Returns:
true if successful, else false
Throws:
DeviceException - for the standard reasons that are documented in DeviceException and also:
  • with code BAD_CONTROL_MODE - if the control is not open
  • with code BAD_CONTROL_MODE - if the power state is not either OFF or CARD_ABSENT when the method is called
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if mode is not a valid constant

getMode

int getMode()
            throws DeviceException
Returns the smart card reader slot operating mode.

This method is synchronous. The information is locally stored in the control object; the value is updated when one of the methods affecting the card slot power state (powerOn(), powerOff(), reset()) is successfully completed.

Returns:
a constant indicating the smart card reader slot operating mode; ISO or EMV as defined in SCSControl.
Throws:
DeviceException - for the standard reasons that are documented in DeviceException and also:
  • with code BAD_CONTROL_MODE - if the control is not open

powerOn

ATR powerOn()
            throws DeviceException
Applies power to the smart card reader slot, performing a cold reset.

Calling this method when the slot power is off will normally reset the card, resulting in the transmission of an ATR by the card in the slot.

This method is asynchronous and results in an SCSOperationResult sent to the powerOnCompleted method of the registered SCSOperationListener. On success, the reset data can be retrieved using the operation event's getData method.

Throws:
DeviceException - for the standard reasons that are documented in DeviceException and also:
  • with code BAD_CONTROL_MODE - if the card slot power state is not OFF
See Also:
SCSOperationListener#powerOnCompleted, SCSOperationResult#getData

powerOff

void powerOff()
              throws DeviceException
Removes power from the smart card reader slot.

This method is asynchronous and results in an SCSOperationResult sent to the powerOffCompleted method of the registered SCSOperationListener.

Throws:
DeviceException - for the standard reasons that are documented in DeviceException and also:
  • with code BAD_CONTROL_MODE - if the card slot power state is not ON
See Also:
SCSOperationListener#powerOffCompleted

reset

ATR reset()
          throws DeviceException
Performs a warm reset on the reader slot. With an asynchronous card, this will normally result in the transmission of an ATR by the card in the slot.

This method is asynchronous and results in an SCSOperationResult sent to the resetCompleted method of the registered SCSOperationListener. On success, the reset data can be retrieved using the operation event's getData method.

Throws:
DeviceException - for the standard reasons that are documented in DeviceException and also:
  • with code BAD_CONTROL_MODE - if the card slot power state is not ON
See Also:
SCSOperationListener#resetCompleted, SCSOperationResult#getData

transmit

byte[] transmit(byte[] buffer)
                throws DeviceException
Sends a data buffer to the smart card reader.

sendData() accepts a length parameter to allow it to be used with static application buffers.

In the context of synchronous smartcards, the format of the data in buffer is card dependent.

In the context of standard EMV or ISO T=0/T=1 asynchronous smartcards, the format of the data in buffer must respect the APDU format defined by the ISO 7816-4 and EMV specifications. If the data cannot be processed because it does not respect the standard APDU formats, then the completion event will contain EVT_ERROR and ERR_PROTOCOL.
ISO 7816-4 case 4 APDUs used with T=0 smart cards are automatically converted into an appropriate sequence of TPDUs, consistent with the current operating mode (EMV or ISO).
All the response data, resulting from a given APDU command that was transmitted to the card, are automatically entirely retrieved, stored and made accessible to the application thru the resulting completion event (sequence of "get-response" card command is automatically processed when applicable).

This method is asynchronous and results in an SCSOperationResult sent to the sendDataCompleted method of the registered SCSOperationListener. On success, the received data can be retrieved using the operation event's getData method.

Parameters:
buffer - data buffer to be transmitted
Throws:
DeviceException - for the standard reasons that are documented in DeviceException and also:
  • with code BAD_CONTROL_MODE - if the card slot power state is not ON
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if buffer is null, or start and/or len are invalid when applied to this buffer. (But note: it is equally valid for platform implementations to report illegal arguments using an operation completion event with status EVT_ERROR and information code ERR_BAD_ARGUMENT)
See Also:
SCSOperationListener#sendDataCompleted, SCSOperationResult#getData

listenForCardInsert

void listenForCardInsert(OperationListener listener)
                         throws DeviceException
Listens until a card is inserted in this terminal. A callback will be called when the card is inserted or the card is present already.

Parameters:
listener -
Throws:
DeviceException

waitForCardInsert

boolean waitForCardInsert(int timeout)
                          throws DeviceException
Waits until a card is inserted in this terminal or the timeout expires. If the method returns due to an expired timeout, it returns false. Otherwise it return true.
If a card is present in this terminal when this method is called, it returns immediately.

Parameters:
timeout - if positive, block for up to timeout milliseconds; if zero, return immediately; if -1, block indefinitely
Returns:
true if the card is inserted within the timeout, otherwise false.
Throws:
DeviceException

listenForCardRemoved

void listenForCardRemoved(OperationListener listener)
                          throws DeviceException
Listens until a card is removed from this terminal. A callback will be called when the card is removed or the card is absent already.

Parameters:
listener -
Throws:
DeviceException

waitForCardRemoved

boolean waitForCardRemoved(int timeout)
                           throws DeviceException
Waits until a card is removed from this terminal or the timeout expires. If the method returns due to an expired timeout, it returns false. Otherwise it return true.
If a card is absent in this terminal when this method is called, it returns immediately.

Parameters:
timeout - if positive, block for up to timeout milliseconds; if zero, return immediately; if -1, block indefinitely
Returns:
true if the card is removed within the timeout, otherwise false.
Throws:
DeviceException
